page.title: 07Roads and Transport
page.content: The M5 runs right through the Lox Yeo valley. It only affects half the farms in the area. The M5 has 27 junctions. It starts at Exeter and ends at Birmingham. On the 23rd and the 24th June 1985, the average hourly number of cars and vans and lorries was 1,125 per hour. In one 24 hour period 27,000 vehicles travelled between Bristol and Bridgwater. The motorway does not really affect the life of the villagers, except when it's raining and the wind is in the wrong direction. Almost all the roads going through Christon and Loxton have only about ten cars an hour.
